Eat eggs during pregnancy to improve cognitive function of children?

Pregnant women that were given twice the RDA for choline (930 mg/day) during their third trimester had children with cognitive benefits including faster information processing speeds.https://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2018-01/cu-emf010418.php …

Lack of sleep may increase the risk for Alzheimer's disease.

Poor sleep boosted levels of amyloid beta (biomarker linked to Alzheimer's) by 25-30% in participants. Sleep is important to activate the glymphatic system which clears brain amyloid plaques.https://source.wustl.edu/2017/12/lack-sleep-boosts-levels-alzheimers-proteins/ …

How does red meat affect heart health?

Meta-analysis of 24 randomized controlled trials finds that eating ≥0.5 servings of red meat per day has no negative effect on blood lipids, lipoproteins, and blood pressure over a short period of time (2–32 wk). http://ajcn.nutrition.org/content/105/1/57.long …
Lutein

Observational studies are never conclusive. But they are still interesting particularly with the totality of other evidence. Randomized controlled trials with compounds enriched in leafy greens such as lutein have shown that cognition is improved after supplementing with lutein.

People who ate 1 serving of green, leafy vegetables performed better on learning/memory tests and showed an equivalent of being 11 years younger cognitively than people who rarely ate them.https://www.rush.edu/news/press-releases/daily-leafy-greens-may-slow-cognitive-decline …
